experience.title: Lead Software Engineer
responsibilities: Manages team of Enterprise Solutions engineers.
Meets weekly with engineers to resolve issues and plan employee growth.
Develops, refines, and implements team engineering practices and processes.
Elicits feedback and represents team in planning of Losant platform features.
Defines project requirements and writes technical components of statements of work.
Serves as full-stack engineering lead on enterprise projects.

experience.title: Software Engineer
responsibilities: Evaluates IoT needs of enterprise clients to enhance their data and products.
Designs unique IoT solutions to meet clients’ business needs.
Plans application architecture for secure, robust, reliable, and scalable software.
Develops web applications to bridge the gap between raw IoT data and end-users.
Creates React applications, using both Redux and functional component hooks.
Integrates and expands on Losant’s web application enablement platform.

experience.title: Web Designer / Developer II
responsibilities: Writes custom web applications for clients using frameworks such as Angular.
Creates high-performance API integrations with proprietary SaaS platform.
Mentors team members through code reviews, project design, and training sessions.
Identifies workflow bottlenecks and creates tools and processes for addressing them.
Oversees shared code libraries and expands them with reusable and robust solutions.
Handles escalated issues and projects to ensure customer satisfaction.

experience.title: Web Designer / Developer I
responsibilities: Builds top-class WordPress themes from scratch, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP.
Creates custom plugins to modularize development tasks and add end-user capabilities.
Develops integrations with third party libraries, frameworks, and APIs.
Integrates websites with mySQL and other custom databases.
Creates custom designs, incorporating client branding with modern aesthetics.
Works directly with clients to refine requirements and develop website strategies.
Develops and iterates on company processes and tools to streamline development.
Provides training sessions with clients to teach basic content management.

experience.title: Project and Web Coordinator
responsibilities: Developed multiple websites to have greater scope and responsive designs.
Extended content management systems with custom front and back-end code development.
Created custom API integrations for both websites and internal applications.
Trained approximately 50 employees website content management via live workshops.
Designed print collateral, including flyers, t-shirts, and posters.
Created original videos for recruitment, fundraising, and website features.
Appeared monthly on local radio station WMJR 94.9 FM/1380 AM
Created and delivered live presentations (approx. 1/month) to congregations and schools.
Wrote quarterly newspaper articles for Cross Roads (bi-weekly, 15K).
Planned annual events and conferences, including marketing and logistics.
Managed a summer youth program, including supervision of 4 seasonal employees.

experience.title: Project Coordinator
responsibilities: Created and maintained websites and social media, including a custom WordPress blog.
Coordinated events of the graduate school, including marketing and day-of coordination.
Designed posters, event flyers, and resources for university programs.
Redesigned graduate school's email newsletter using custom HTML5 and CSS3.
Delivered live presentations in person and via regular webinars to promote offerings.
Created marketing videos for events and programs, as well as fundraising videos.
Supervised graduate assistants and in developing goals for their work.

experience.title: Post Production Assistant
responsibilities: Edited training and marketing videos for Fortune 100 and Fortune 1000 clients.
Designed logos and graphical video assets using Adobe Photoshop suite.
Assisted on video production shoots including lighting, sound, staging, and camera.
Wrote and edited scripts for videos, including internal corporate communications.
Designed and published internal communication documents.

certifications.title: Professional Scrum Master
competencies: Understanding and applying the Scrum Framework

certifications.title: AWS Cloud Practicioner
competencies: Understanding the AWS shared responsibility model.
Applying AWS Cloud security best practices.
Following AWS Cloud costs, economics, and billing practices.
Knowing and placing the core AWS services, including compute, network, databases, and storage.
Recognizing AWS services for common use cases.
